required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Subjectively Perceived Pelvic Floor Function in Patients With Gynecological Tumors and Breast Cancer Under Systemic Tumor Therapy Using a Validated Questionnaire
clinical_study.official_title: PANTHERA-Studie "Pelvic Floor Disorders in Patients Under ANtineoplastic THERApy"

brief_summary.textblock: The multimodal therapy of gynecological malignancies and breast cancer often leads to an impairment of the pelvic floor function. This has a major impact on the quality of life of cancer patients. The aim of the study is to record and analyze the potential subjective impairment of the bladder, bowel and sexual function under systemic tumor therapy as well as possible influencing factors by means of validated disease-specific questionnaires. to find possible starting points for the prevention and treatment of the symptoms.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint and basis for the sample size calculation is the incidence of clinically relevant deteriorations in the total score of pelvic floor function. Bladder function, bowel function, sedimentation problems and sexual function, QoL are recorded using scores using the validated German pelvic floor questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: Type of tumor (breast cancer, ovarian cancer, cervical cancer, endometrial cancer, vulvar cancer), TNM stage, body weight, height, age, type of tumor therapy, number of previous therapies (chemoline), parity, mode of delivery, nicotine abuse, medication, previous surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with gynecological tumors and breast cancer under systemic tumor therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Breastcancer under tumor therapy
- Gynecological carcinoma under tumor therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
